page.title: 07VILLAGE OF GARTLY
page.content: NJ522321 -{THE VILLAGE OF GARTLY}lies alongside the River Bogie between the A97 and the railway. It is roughly L-shaped,with the base running from the A97 across the railway (Station Road),and the back (Park Lane) running vaguely parallel to the main road etc. Station Rd contains the oldest houses. Over the level crossing are 5 houses (4 of them holiday homes) and 2 other private houses in their own grounds. Station Road continues up Tor Hill and 4 miles on, meets the A96(T) road at Slioch crossroads. Park Lane contains,on the side further from the river, a row and semi-circle of 20 terraced and semi-detached Council houses,some of which are now privately owned,a block of 4 old-folks'houses(2 up,2 down)and the school house rented meantime to someone other than the Head Teacher.
